Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050915 Firefox/1.0.7

 The system has attempted to use an undefined value, which usually indicates a
programming error, either in your code or some system code.

Null Pointers are another name for undefined values.
 
The error occurred in /srv/www/htdocs/Application.cfm: line 1

1 : <cfapplication name="cmlhome" clientmanagement="yes" sessionmanagement="yes"
setclientcookies="yes">
2 : <!--- <cferror type = "exception" template = "include/error_emailerror.cfm">
 --->
3 : 


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.go to website
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
Above message in details

Expected Results:  
Open website

comments.text:
WFM
Firefox 1.0.7
Windows XP

Where is this error appearing?  Opening the website shows none of these errors.
 The website seemed to have some connectivity problems earlier today, could
there have been server issues?

Could you also please expand on this bug report. What are you actually reporting?

comments.raw_text: Server-side errors are not Firefox's fault.
comments.text: Server-side errors are not Firefox's fault.
